page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT
page.content: On the 1st May I went with some of my class to the job centre to find out what the employment situation was like in Hoyland. Three people work there and they have to have 5 'O' levels. The main work in Hoyland is in making clothing, engineering, bars, catering, cleaning and building. The most popular jobs are driving and building and the least popular labouring and cleaning.17% of the people are unemployed. People come from Wombwell and Barnsley to get jobs but people are not leaving the area to take up jobs. Most of the jobs being offered now are part_time and temporary in pubs and sewing factories. The highest paid job is a computer tutor at Â£131 per week. The strangest job is for a kissogram girl. In the last week in April 312 people used the job centre.
